intro: Euphrasia latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture. Euphrasia latibracteata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows.
